intro: Jankaea heldreichii, commonly known as the Balkan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Jankaea heldreichii is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive blooms.
